subject: Re: [junit] Testing object instantiated by Spring
msgSnippet: ... No, not at all! As long as the objects that I create during the tests share the same configuration I don t have to change anything. However if the created
messageBody:
> I'd probably start with using new, and if things start to get complex, then
> figure out how to use Spring (which isn't that hard I believe).

No, not at all! As long as the objects that I create during the tests
share the same configuration I don't have to change anything. However
if the created objects need to be somehow different than the
production code (different parameter values) then I need to create a
new configuration for this class, etc. But I see your point and that's
how I'm doing it right now.

Thanks,
